ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Of Eram with lofty pillars (erected as signposts in the desert),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: of Iram, known for their lofty columns,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: the people of the huge columned city of Eram
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: (The people of) Aram, possessors of lofty buildings,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: the people of Iram, the city of many pillars,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Of the (city of) Iram, with lofty pillars,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Who were very tall like lofty pillars,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [89:7] Iram — these were the former [people of] ‘Ād (Irama is an explicative supplement or a substitution, and it is treated as a diptote because it is a proper noun and feminine) — of the towering ones, that is to say, the tall ones — the tallest one among them would reach four hundred cubits —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (With many columned) powerful (Iram) the son of Iram; Iram is Shem son of Noah who had a son called Shim and the later had a son called Ham who himself had a son called 'Aad,
